title.content-text: 6.1.2 - Knowing the Numbers - Binary to Decimal Conversion

brief.content-text: The diagram depicts the process described in diagram 1 to calculate the decimal equivalent of the entire 32-bit IP address into four decimal octets. In the example, the 32-bit binary number 10101100 00010000 00000100 00010100 is converted into decimal IPv4 address 172.16.4.20. Each octet decimal value is separated by a period.
